title: Haris and bowlers help Pakistan rout Oman in Asia cup
byline: Mohammad Haris hit a return-to-form half century before bowlers routed Oman as Pakistan opened their Asia Cup campaign with a 93-run win over Oman in Dubai on Friday.

title: PM discusses issues of university non-academic staff
byline: A discussion was held at the Prime Minister’s Office under the patronage of Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya to address several issues faced by university non-academic employees.

title: Nigerian pilot tests positive for alcohol after plane veered off runway
byline: A pilot and co-pilot have tested positive for alcohol after the plane they were operating veered off the runway when landing in Nigeria.

title: Central Bank of Sri Lanka releases key findings of Systemic Risk Survey
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has released key findings of the Systemic Risk Survey (SRS) conducted for the second half of 2025.

title: Dhammika Perera completes equal partnership in Laugfs with co-founder Wegapitiya
byline: Business tycoon Dhammika Perera has completed the acquisition of a 50 percent stake in Laugfs Holdings Ltd through his private vehicle Vallibel Three (Pvt.) Ltd, filings to the Colombo Stock Exchange showed yesterday.

title: Asia Cup 2025: Sri Lanka need 140 runs to beat Bangladesh
byline: After teetering on 11 for 3, Jaker and Shamim put on an unbeaten 86-run partnership for the sixth wicket to get Bangladesh to a total of 139 for 5.

title: Opposition may take legal action against Deputy Ministers under Public Properties Act: Dayasiri
byline: The Opposition in Parliament is contemplating taking legal action against Deputy Ministers under the Public Properties Act for using perks such as staff payments allowance, Opposition MP Dayasiri Jayasekera said today.

title: Ex-soldier suspected in four murders arrested
byline: A former army soldier suspected of involvement in four murders, including the killing of a former prison officer in Bandaragama and the shooting of two youths in Borella, has been arrested by the Police Special Task Force (STF).

title: President congratulates Nepal’s first woman interim Prime Minister
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has extended his congratulations to Sushila Karki on her appointment as the Prime Minister of Nepal’s interim government.

title: Indian tourists entertain at Nanu Oya railway station
byline: A group of Indian tourists who had arrived in Sri Lanka for a tour were seen singing and dancing at the Nanu Oya Railway Station yesterday (13).

title: Sri Lanka expresses concerns over strikes on Qatar without naming Israel
byline: In the wake of Israeli strikes  on Doha targeting Hamas leaders, Sri Lanka has expressed solidarity with Qatar.

title: Two arrested for dumping cattle carcasses in Ritigala Reserve
byline: Two individuals were arrested for dumping body parts of slaughtered cattle inside the Ritigala Strict Nature Reserve, officials of the Ritigala Wildlife Sanctuary said.

title: World has lost empathy, understanding, respect for different ideas: Sajith
byline: The world has lost empathy, understanding and respect for different ideas, Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa said today.

title: Death toll rises to 16
byline: Another victim of the Ella–Wellawaya bus accident has succumbed to her injuries, raising the death toll to 16, hospital sources said.

title: Showers expected in several provinces after 1 p.m. – Met Dept.
byline: Showers are expected at several places in the Eastern and Uva provinces after 1.00 p.m., while a few spells of showers will occur in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces, as well as in the Galle, Matara, Kandy and Nuwara Eliya districts, the Forecasting Division of the National Meteorological Centre said.

title: Nepal sets March elections after naming interim prime minister
byline: Nepal’s President Ramchandra Paudel dissolved parliament and called for fresh elections on March 5, his office said late on Friday, following a week of deadly violence that culminated in the appointment of the country’s first woman Prime Minister in the interim.

title: Ex-UC chairman, businessman arrested over illegal vehicle imports
byline: Former Chairman of the Wattegama Urban Council, Ravindra Bandara, and businessman Lakshitha Manoj Weerabahu were arrested over an allegedly illegal vehicle import and registration racket, police said.

title: Akram tells Pakistan, India to forget noise and ’enjoy’ Asia Cup clash
byline: The Group A match in Dubai is the first clash on the cricket field between the countries since a military conflict four months ago took relations between the nuclear-armed neighbours to their lowest point in decades.

title: Karting in Sri Lanka changes gears
byline: At a glittering launch at Waters Edge at Battaramulla on Thursday, David Peiris Group of Companies and its partner Speed Bay introduced the Sodikart kart in Sri Lanka. It meant that karting will now feature what is said to be enhanced performance and improved safety with the participants eligible for the Sodi World Series according to its promoters who said it marked the beginning of a new era in motorsports in Sri Lanka.

title: Weekend Sports Action for Sri Lankan Fans: Brace yourself for Manchester Derby, India vs Pakistan and more
byline: Sri Lankan sports fans are preparing for one of the most exciting weekends of 2025 as football, cricket, and athletics dominate screens from September 13–14.

title: Record breaker Salt wants to be world’s best
byline: Phil Salt has set his sights on becoming the ’’best in the world’’ as a T20 opener after smashing a record-breaking century in England’s 146-run victory over South Africa.

title: Grudge battle, body blows await Sri Lanka, Bangladesh
byline: Sri Lanka will launch their Asia Cup 2025 campaign this evening in Abu Dhabi against Bangladesh, fielding a three-pronged pace attack in a contest that already carries the feel of a knockout.

title: Businessman nabbed at BIA with foreign-made cigarettes
byline: A 51-year-old businessman was arrested this morning at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) while attempting to smuggle foreign-made cigarettes valued at Rs. 3.45 million into the country.

title: Removing former president’s perks is only carrying out our election promise: Handunnetti
byline: Claiming that there is nothing to be surprised about removing former presidents’ perks and privileges, as it is only carrying out a promise made to the people, Minister Sunil Handunnetti said people should be perturbed only if the government failed to do so.

title: 42 per cent of all employed Sri Lankans are not even O/L qualified
byline: As many as 42 per cent of all employed Sri Lankans in the public and private sectors have educational qualification levels only up to grade 10, and only 26.7 per cent of people have qualifications above Advanced Levels, according to the Department of Census and Statistics (DCS).
